title: Simply calling gazebo::printVersion() requires unrolling ~300k lines of header includes

content.raw:
the declaration of gazebo::printVersion is found only in gazebo/gazebo.hh (and a couple other functions too)

so if I want to call this, I must #include <gazebo/gazebo.hh>, which unrolls into ~300k lines (meaning it takes a long time to compile due to a single function I want to call):

$ echo "#include <gazebo/gazebo.hh>" | g++ -E -xc++ - | wc -l
306742

please consider refactoring the declarations found in gazebo/gazebo.hh to a dedicated header or headers, so that I can include the minimum declarations necessary to do what I need to do, and keep my builds lean & quick
